ManSection.Description: Returns true if the given vector space with integral structure has an embedding into a super space, false otherwise.
Returns true if the given vector space with integral structure has a concrete presentation, false otherwise.
Returns true if the given virtual Hilbert polynomial has only integral values, false otherwise.
Returns true if the given virtual cohomology table has only integral values, false otherwise.
Returns the length of the root sequence in this poset.
Returns the poset of root sequence in which the given root sequence lies.
Computes the virtual Hilbert polynomial associated to the virtual vector bundle of rank 1 with supernatural cohomology given by the root sequence.
Computes the virtual cohomology table associated to the virtual vector bundle of rank 1 with supernatural cohomology given by the root sequence.
Returns the category of intervals of root sequences.
Returns the poset of root sequences in which all root sequences within the given interval lie in.
Returns the left boundary of the given interval of root sequences.
Returns the right boundary of the given interval of root sequences.
Computes the underlying set of the given interval of root sequences.
Computes the largest maximal chain of the given interval of root sequences.
Computes a chain of root sequences whose corresponding Hilbert polynomials form a basis of the vector space of Hilbert polynomials within interval_of_root_sequences.

ManSection.Returns: a list of pairs of integers
ManSection.Description: Computes the entries of a cohomology table within interval_of_root_sequences which can be modified without changing the Hilbert polynomial.
Returns the source of the given morphism of intervals of root sequences.
Returns the range of the given morphism of intervals of root sequences.
Returns the poset of root sequences associated to the given virtual cohomology table.
Computes the Betti table of the given virtual cohomology table
Computes the Hilbert polynomial of the given virtual cohomology table
Computes the interval of the minimal ambient space of the given virtual cohomology table
Returns the underlying polynomial of the given virtual Hilbert polynomial.
Computes the embedding of the one dimensional vector space spanned by the given virtual Hilbert polynomial into the vector space of all virtual Hilbert polynomials.

ManSection.Returns: an element of a graded relative ring
ManSection.Description: Computes the corresponding element in the Grothendieck Group of stable modules over the exterior algebra.

ManSection.Returns: A list with an integer and a chern polynomial with rank
ManSection.Description: Computes a pair containing the normalized Chern polynomial together with the twist which was needed for normalization.
Returns the underlying structure morphism which defines the lattice of the input.
Returns the underlying vector space, i.e., the vector space without the integral structure.
Returns the dimension of the given vector space with integral structure.

ManSection.Returns: a vector space with integral structure
ManSection.Description: Returns the embedding of an embedded vector space with integral structure.
Returns the position of the concrete presentation of the given concrete vector space with integral structure.
Returns the underlying morphism of \mathbb{Q}-spaces of the given morphism of vector spaces with integral structure

ManSection.Returns: a vector space with integral structure
ManSection.Description: Returns the source of the given morphism.

ManSection.Returns: a vector space with integral structure
ManSection.Description: Returns the range of the given morphism.
Computes the value of virtual_hilbert_polynomial at rational
Computes the infimum of root_sequence_1 and root_sequence_2 regarded as elements of the poset of all root sequences
The input is a list of root sequences. The operation returns the infimum of all elements in the given list.
Computes the supremum of root_sequence_1 and root_sequence_2 regarded as elements of the poset of all root sequences.
The input is a list of root sequences. The operation returns the supremum of all elements in the given list.
The input is a list of root sequences. The operation returns the list of coefficients of the given polynomial up to degree degree.
Sets the display interval of virtual cohomology tables. Every list of integers is accepted as an input.

This operation uses the Boij-Soederberg cone. If filter = true (default) this operation also takes into consideration that a vector bundle of rank r has vanishing Chern classes c_l for l > r. It computes all Hilbert polynomials (and if filter = true also the corresponding Chern polynomials with shift) within the given interval which cannot be excluded by combinatorial means to be associated to vector bundles with given rank.

This operation uses the Boij-Soederberg cone. It computes all virtual cohomology tables within the given interval which cannot be excluded by combinatorial means to be associated to vector bundles with given Hilbert polynomial.
Constructs a poset of root sequences of given length.

The first argument is a list of integers, not necessarily sorted, which also may contain duplicates. The second optional argument is a poset of root sequences of which the constructed root sequence shall be an element. If no second argument is given, a standard poset of root sequences will be created and cached.

The two arguments define the left boundary and the right boundary of an interval of root sequences. The first argument must be smaller or equal to the second argument. This operation constructs an interval of root sequences [ root_sequence_1 .. root_sequence_2 ].
Constructs the trivial interval of root sequences [ root_sequence .. root_sequence ].

ManSection.Returns: a morphism of intervals of root sequences
ManSection.Description: The interval_of_root_sequences_source must be contained in interval_of_root_sequences_source. It constructs a morphism from interval_of_root_sequences_source to interval_of_root_sequences_range.

The argument must be a list of pairs consisting of a rational number and a root sequence. This operation constructs a virtual cohomology table which corresponds to the linear combination given by list.

The first argument is a list of rational numbers. This operation constructs a virtual cohomology table computed as linear combination with coefficients given in list and vectors given as the top maximal chain of the interval_of_root_sequences.
The argument is a list of rational numbers, where the i-th argument contains the i-1-th coefficient of the virtual Hilbert polynomial to be constructed.
Constructs a virtual Hilbert polynomial with underlying polynomial polynomial.
Constructs a virtual Hilbert polynomial corresponding to root_sequence.
Constructs a virtual Hilbert polynomial associated to virtual_cohomology_table.

ManSection.Returns: a vector space with integral structure
ManSection.Description: The input is a map V \rightarrow W of \mathbb{Q}-spaces. The basis of the pushed presentation to W will be the lattice basis of the output.

ManSection.Returns: a vector space with integral structure
ManSection.Description: The first argument must be a list of univariate linearly independent polynomials over \mathbb{Q}. The second argument is the maximal degree of the polynomials of the ambient space. This operation constructs a vector space with integral structure generated by the polynomials in list_of_hilbert_polynomials and embedded in the ambient space of polynomials of degree degree.

Constructor of a morphism of vector spaces with integral structure. The first and the second argument are vector spaces with integral structure representing the source and the target of the morphism. The third argument represents the underlying morphism \alpha of vector spaces. If \alpha is not integral written with respect to the lattice structure, the constructor will give an error.

ManSection.Returns: a morphism of vector spaces with integral structure
ManSection.Description: Constructor of a morphism of a vector spaces with integral structure . The first argument V is a vector space with integral structure, whose underlying vector space must be identical to the range of the second argument, which is a monomorphism \alpha of vector spaces. This operation constructs a morphism of vector spaces with integral structure whose underlying morphism equals \alpha. It is the maximal morphism with this property.

This functor maps a morphism of intervals of root sequences I \rightarrow J to the embedding of vector space of Hilbert polynomials lying above the interval I into the vector space of Hilbert polynomials lying above the interval J.

This functor maps a morphism of intervals of root sequences I \rightarrow J to the embedding of vector space of cohomology tables lying above the interval I into the vector space of cohomology tables lying above the interval J.
This primitive functor associates to a natural number n the vector space of Hilbert polynomials of degree n.
